â
'''Stanislav Yanevski''' ({{lang-bg|Ð¡ÑÐ°Ð½Ð¸ÑÐ»Ð°Ð² Ð¯Ð½ÐµÐ²ÑÐºÐ¸}}; born [[May 16]], [[1985]]) is a [[Bulgarians|Bulgarian]] actor, known for playing [[Viktor Krum]] in the 2005 film ''[[Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)|Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire]]''.
+
'''Stanislav Ianevski''' ({{lang-bg|Ð¡ÑÐ°Ð½Ð¸ÑÐ»Ð°Ð² Ð¯Ð½ÐµÐ²ÑÐºÐ¸}}; born [[May 16]], [[1985]]) is a [[Bulgarians|Bulgarian]] actor, known for playing [[Viktor Krum]] in the 2005 film ''[[Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)|Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire]]''.
â
Yanevski was born in [[Sofia, Bulgaria]] and has lived in [[England]] (for five years)<ref name=ref/> and [[Israel]].<ref>[http://www.comingsoon.net/news/topnews.php?id=10507 The New Blood From Goblet of Fire - ComingSoon.net<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.snitchseeker.com/harry-potter-news/stanislav-ianevski-sugar-magazine-29429/ Stanislav Yanevski in Sugar Magazine - SnitchSeeker.com<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> While attending [[Mill Hill School]] in the [[United Kingdom]], Ianevski had no particular acting aspirations and was not a drama student. He had only auditioned for ''[[Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)|Harry Potter]]'' after being spotted by [[Fiona Weir]], a casting director who prompted him to attend an acting workshop, which resulted in his casting as [[Viktor Krum]], a [[Bulgaria]]n character in the [[Harry Potter]] series. He was selected from 600 others, most of whom had auditioned in [[Sofia, Bulgaria]]. [[Harry Melling (actor)|Harry Melling]], who played the part of [[Dudley Dursley]], attended Mill Hill School at the same time.
+
Ianevski was born in [[Sofia, Bulgaria]] and has lived in [[England]] (for five years)<ref name=ref/> and [[Israel]].<ref>[http://www.comingsoon.net/news/topnews.php?id=10507 The New Blood From Goblet of Fire - ComingSoon.net<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.snitchseeker.com/harry-potter-news/stanislav-ianevski-sugar-magazine-29429/ Stanislav Ianevski in Sugar Magazine - SnitchSeeker.com<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> While attending [[Mill Hill School]] in the [[United Kingdom]], Ianevski had no particular acting aspirations and was not a drama student. He had only auditioned for ''[[Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)|Harry Potter]]'' after being spotted by [[Fiona Weir]], a casting director who prompted him to attend an acting workshop, which resulted in his casting as [[Viktor Krum]], a [[Bulgaria]]n character in the [[Harry Potter]] series. He was selected from 600 others, most of whom had auditioned in [[Sofia, Bulgaria]]. [[Harry Melling (actor)|Harry Melling]], who played the part of [[Dudley Dursley]], attended Mill Hill School at the same time.
â
Yanevski's casting was announced in June 2004. During filming, he befriended fellow ''Harry Potter'' actors [[Robert Pattinson]] and [[Emma Watson]]. He also starred in ''[[Hostel 2]]'', the sequel to [[Eli Roth]]'s film ''[[Hostel (film)|Hostel]]''. It was announced that he will be reprising his role as Viktor Krum, in the upcoming ''[[Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows (films)|Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows]]'' Part 1.{{Citation needed|date=July 2009}}
+
Ianevski's casting was announced in June 2004. During filming, he befriended fellow ''Harry Potter'' actors [[Robert Pattinson]] and [[Emma Watson]]. He also starred in ''[[Hostel 2]]'', the sequel to [[Eli Roth]]'s film ''[[Hostel (film)|Hostel]]''. It was announced that he will be reprising his role as Viktor Krum, in the upcoming ''[[Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows (films)|Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows]]'' Part 1.{{Citation needed|date=July 2009}}
â
Yanevski has a sister and several pets. He is a follower of the [[Bulgarian national football team]].<ref name=ref>[http://www.novinite.com/view_news.php?id=55852 Stanislav Ianevski: Proud to be Bulgarian<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
+
Ianevski has a sister and several pets. He is a follower of the [[Bulgarian national football team]].<ref name=ref>[http://www.novinite.com/view_news.php?id=55852 Stanislav Ianevski: Proud to be Bulgarian<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
